Galaxy morphology estimator function

Our primary package, GalMorph, consists of a number of modules, each carrying out a specific role in order to ultimately categorize a set of input galaxies.

We describe all the modules in detail below.

class core.GalMorph(file_path)

A class for analyzing and visualizing galaxy morphology data.

data

DataFrame containing galaxy morphology data loaded from a pickle file.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

snapshot_values

List of unique snapshot values in the data.

Type:

list

Galaxy_count(file_name='galaxy_count.png')

Plots the number of galaxies for each snapshot and saves the plot as an image.

Parameters:

file_name (str) – Name of the output image file for the plot. Default is “galaxy_count.png”.

Galaxy_type_snap(snapshot_num: int = 25, output_fname='bar.png')

Plots a bar chart of galaxy type counts for a specific snapshot and saves the plot as an image.

Parameters:

  • snapshot_num (int) – The snapshot number to analyze. Default is 25.

  • output_fname (str) – Name of the output image file for the plot. Default is “bar.png”.
